New Records: The Cavaliers extended their winning streak to 10, with all 10 victories in the streak being by double digits, a franchise record.
Key Match Events: Cleveland began the second quarter with a 24-6 run, fueled by its two big men, to build a commanding 53-29 lead.
Evan Mobley denied Charlotte Hornets with a stuff.
Pre-Game Insights: Isaac Okoro was cleared to practice with no restrictions after being sidelined since Dec. 20 with a right shoulder sprain.
Post-Match Reflections: The Cavaliers won for the 18th time in 19 home games and are 31-4 overall.
The Hornets dropped their 10th in a row and are 1-18 since Nov. 23.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Jarrett Allen had 19 points and 11 rebounds.
Donovan Mitchell had 17 of his 19 points in the second half.
LaMelo Ball and Brandon Miller paced Charlotte with 24 points apiece.
Nick Smith Jr. had 18 off the bench.
Others: Only four teams in NBA history have posted a better record through 35 games than the Cavaliers: Golden State (33-2) in 2015-16, Philadelphia (32-3) in 1966-67, the Los Angeles Lakers (32-3) in 1971-72 and Chicago (32-3) in 1995-96.
